content.text:
# Draft:Effie Woodward Fifield

Effie Woodward Merriman Fifield (February 17, 1857 – November 21, 1937) was an American playwright and author.
Effie Woodward was born on February 17, 1857 in Hyde Park Township, Minnesota, the daufhter of Charles E. Woodward and Marie Sias Woodward.
Effie Woodward Fifield died on 21 November 1937 in Crescenta Valley.
Personal life
She married Frank T. Merriman in 1879 and James Clark Fifield in 1906.
Bibliography
* Pards: A Story of Two Homeless Boys (Lee & Shepards, 1891)
* A Queer Family (Lee & Shepards, 1891)
* The Little Millers (Lee & Shepards, 1891)
* The Conways (Lee & Shepard, 1893)
* The family doctor book : Containing plain and simple directions for the treatment of every disease and ailment, and suggesting simple home remedies which will usually effect a cure without the necessity of employing a physician (1893)
* ''The young author's assistant and guide (1894)
* Mollie Miller  (Lee & Shepard, 1895)
* How Women May Earn Money  (1898)
* A Queer Dilemma and Other Stories'' (Minneapolis, Minnesota: The Franklin Taylor Pub Co, 1898) '
* Sir Jefferson Nobody (A. C. McClurg Co., 1900)
* Rejuvenated (Minneapolis, Minnesota: The Midwest Company, 1928)  as Mrs. James Fifield
Housekeeper, 1897-1902.
Plays
* Maud Muller: A Burlesque Entertainment in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1891)
* Socials (Chicago: C. H. Sergel & Co., 1891)
* A Pair of Artists: A Comedy in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1892)
* Diamonds and Hearts: A Comedy-Drama in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1897)
* Comedies for Children: A Collection of One-Act Plays (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* ''The Drunkard’s Family: A Children's Play in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* In Klondyke: A Children's Drama in One Act  (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Marian’s Wish: A Children's Play in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Modern Entertainments (1898)
* The Mysterious Guest: A Children's Play in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* The Rigmaree: A Children's Play in One Act  (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* The Sick Doll: A Children's Play in One Act  (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* The Stolen Cat: A Children's Play in One Act  (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Three Newsboys: A Children's Play in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Through a Matrimonial Bureau: A Comedietta in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Tompkin's Hired Man: A Drama in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* What Ailed Maudie: A Children's Play in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1898)
* Their First Meeting: A Comedietta in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1899)
* The Bachelor’s Club (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1901)
* The Emerson Club: Comedy in One Act (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1901)
* A Girl's Secret: A Play in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1901)
* The Hypnotist  (1901)
* The Silent Detective: A Drama in Three Acts (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1901)
* The Great Plummer Breach-of-Promise Case: A Mock Trial (Chicago: Dramatic Publishing, 1902)
* A Twentieth Century Proposal (1902)
* The Rehearsal (1909)
* Deacon Jenkins Choir Meeting (Franklin, Ohio: Eldridge, 1924)
* Uncle Ben Drake'' (1926) as Mrs. J. C. Fifield
